<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;vertical-align: top" valign="top">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: separate" width="100%">
<tr>
<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong>After weeks of sentimental intros, let's kick off this Father's Day edition with a few of my favorite dad jokes. If you're not groaning loud enough for your neighbors to hear, I didn't do my job. </p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>I was wondering why this frisbee kept looking bigger and bigger. Then it hit me.</span></li>
<li><span>Why can't you trust atoms? They make up everything.</span></li>
<li><span>Three conspiracy theorists walk into a bar. That can't just be a coincidence.</span></li>
<li><span>Does anyone need an ark? I Noah guy.</span></li>
<li><span>If you ever want to talk about why our air conditioning bill is so high, my door is always open.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Happy Father's Day!</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal Freyman</p>
</div>

</tr>

Stock Watch: Movie Dads
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDgzL3N0b2NrX3dhdGNoX21vdmllX2RhZHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="A chart plotting five iconic movie dads. 1977: Darth Vader is that classic strict dad who simply wants to kill his son to squash a rebellion. 1993: Robin Williams wins a Golden Globe for pretending to be an old lady just to see his kids. 1994: Disney didn’t need to traumatize a generation of children with Mufasa’s death, but they did. And we’ll never forgive them. 2006: Will Smith plays a lot of great dads on screen, but Chris Gardner in The Pursuit of Happyness takes the cake. 2008: Liam Neeson’s character in Taken has a very particular set of skills, none of which include making interesting sequels." data-source="Will Varner" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"> </p>

<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers with...Drag Queen Kim Chi
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/17/icebreakers-withdrag-queen-kimchi?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Kim Chi portrait" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDg3L2tpbV9jaGkucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Courtesy of Kim Chi/Tanner Abel</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Kim Chi is a self-described "7-foot tall, live-action anime character and high-fashion model." The drag star and beauty influencer was born in the US, raised in South Korea, and currently spends her time in Chicago with the perfect roommate, her <a href="https://instagram.com/butterthisdog?utm_medium=copy_link" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">french bulldog</a>. After finishing in the top three on season eight of <em>RuPaul's Drag Race, </em>Kim Chi launched her cosmetic company, <a href="https://kimchichicbeauty.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">KimChi Chic Beauty</a>, with entrepreneur and NYX founder Toni Ko in 2019. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">We asked Kim Chi a few Icebreakers.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What's the most important thing you learned when launching your beauty brand?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">To have fun and to create products you know you're gonna have fun with! I think people really vibe with that!</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Who would your dream celebrity collaboration be with?</strong> </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://instagram.com/loonatheworld?utm_medium=copy_link" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">LOONA</a>!!! Haha I love them so much!</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Who creates some of your favorite content online?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">My friend <a href="https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMdrkR2KF/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jonathan Kung</a> creates thoughtful content about food and cooking; <a href="https://instagram.com/timothyhungcom?utm_medium=copy_link" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Timothy Hung</a> is an amazing makeup artist.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What skills could modern business people gain from becoming drag queens?</strong> </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Merchandising, visual merchandising, negotiating for rates, and most importantly, learning how to weed out scammers.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What topic do you wish was a college major but isn't?</strong> </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The history of zombies in pop culture.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What is your favorite compliment you've ever received?</strong> </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">"You always show up on time!"</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What question do you wish people would ask you? </strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">"Have you had your iced coffee today? Would you like some?"</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>This interview has been lightly edited and condensed for clarity.</em></p>

<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Make It Work: Vax Talk in the Office
</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Each week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reader-submitted questions</a> about work in 2021. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>For personal reasons, I don't want to get vaccinated. How do I respond to colleagues asking if I've been vaccinated yet? It seems there's a lot of uncomfortable social pressure around this topic. Thanks, Chris.</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I have noticed that the privacy coworkers used to exercise around personal health information has relaxed over the past year. My own stance on Covid vaccinations aside, I don’t think it’s a proper workplace conversation to have unless in a formal capacity from your employer. And even then it can get a little tricky, which is why we leave that kind of stuff to the professionals who are trained in workplace sensitivity (just in case you’re confused about who that is, boo, that’s me and my friends in human resources).</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Next time one of your coworkers asks you if you’re vaccinated, just say you’re not comfortable sharing personal health decisions or anything else about your medical background. I do have to add that I hope you’ve done your research and made an educated decision on your stance on vaccinations, which have proven to be safe and effective against Covid and are the reason the US is nearly out of this mess. Either way, be thoughtful and follow the proper CDC guidelines for people who are unvaccinated. Summer’s finally here, let’s have fun…responsibly. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Something bothering you at work? </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Ask Kate here</em></a><em>.</em></p>

ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
The Election in Wall Street's Backyard
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/18/know-nycs-upcoming-mayoral-election?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NEW YORK, NY- JUNE 10: Before the second televised debate for the New Yo..." style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDg2L25ld195b3JrX2NpdHlfbWF5b3JhbF9jYW0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Andrew Lichtenstein/Getty Images</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">If you've so far managed to escape the Twitter buzz around the NYC mayoral race, your blissful ride has come to an end. Ahead of the big Democratic primary this Tuesday, here's a primer on the race to succeed Bill de Blasio and lead the country's most populous city. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Who is running?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The better question is who <em>isn't </em>running? With <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nyc-mayoral-race-candidates-11623280789?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">13 candidates</a> on the ballot for the Democratic primary, it's the biggest field in the city's history. Some notable candidates include Brooklyn Borough President Eric Adams, former sanitation commissioner Kathryn Garcia, tech entrepreneur and former presidential candidate Andrew Yang, and former Citigroup exec Ray McGuire.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Who is Wall Street backing?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The city's powerful financiers have mostly thrown their weight behind Yang, McGuire, and Adams. Adams has recently received a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/14/nyc-mayor-race-wall-street-gives-millions-to-eric-adams-andrew-yang.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.5 million boost </a>from NY Mets owner and hedge fund manager Steve Cohen. Other Adams boosters include hedge fund manager Dan Loeb, Citadel CEO Ken Griffin, and legendary investors Stanley Druckenmiller and Paul Tudor Jones.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Big business may prefer Adams, a former NYPD captain, for his focus on public safety. Last October, more than 150 business leaders <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/10/nyregion/de-blasio-economy-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent a letter</a> to Mayor Bill de Blasio saying that degrading quality of life could hinder the city's economic recovery. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>How will the election work? </strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">For the first time, the primary will utilize a format called "<a href="https://ballotpedia.org/Ranked-choice_voting_(RCV)?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ranked-choice voting</a>," which is as if the Joker came along and sprinkled even more chaos onto an already unpredictable race. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/nyregion/ranked-choice-voting-nyc.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ranked-choice voting</a> means that instead of checking one name off on a ballot, NYC voters will be able to put down up to five, ranked by their preference. For another real-world example, the best picture winner at the Oscars is selected by a version of ranked-choice voting. This method means being enough people's No. 2 choice could be a recipe for victory. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Who is going to win? </strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The latest polls show <a href="https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/albany/story/2021/06/14/adams-garcia-top-latest-poll-in-new-york-mayors-race-1386402?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Adams in the lead</a> followed by Garcia, who would be the first woman ever elected mayor of NYC. Although the Republican primary is also happening on Tuesday, in bright-blue NYC the Democratic winner is basically a shoo-in to win the general election in November. </p>

</h1>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that asks the tough questions like, "Why did someone put such a tiny sink in such a wide piece of granite?" We'll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess how much it costs.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/5k2U9vNk2clvXVdQsy/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Listing in Chatham, New Jersey" data-source="Zillow" data-reactroot=""></p>

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Today's <a href="https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/634-Fairmount-Ave-Chatham-NJ-07928/39400689_zpid/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">house</a> is a special treat for Chatham, NJ, dads. While most of us equate "house built in 1906" to "house is full of ghosts," dads see an opportunity to rattle off random historical facts. This old home sits on ¾ of an acre and has some great amenities:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li aria-level="1"><span>3 beds, 4 baths</span></li>
<li aria-level="1">
<span>
</span><span><em>Secret Garden</em></span><span>-esque greenery and a little private pond</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1"><span>Multi-level patio (we did say this was a dad paradise)</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">How much for the historic home?</p>

If you're not groaning loud enough for your neighbors to hear, I didn't do my job. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eI was wondering why this frisbee kept looking bigger and bigger. Then it hit me.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhy can't you trust atoms? They make up everything.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThree conspiracy theorists walk into a bar. That can't just be a coincidence.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDoes anyone need an ark? I Noah guy.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf you ever want to talk about why our air conditioning bill is so high, my door is always open.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHappy Father's Day!\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500\"\u003e—Neal Freyman\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE --\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd align=\"left\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"A chart plotting five iconic movie dads. 1977: Darth Vader is that classic strict dad who simply wants to kill his son to squash a rebellion. 1993: Robin Williams wins a Golden Globe for pretending to be an old lady just to see his kids. 1994: Disney didn’t need to traumatize a generation of children with Mufasa’s death, but they did. border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Kim Chi portrait\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDg3L2tpbV9jaGkucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eCourtesy of Kim Chi/Tanner Abel\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eKim Chi is a self-described \"7-foot tall, live-action anime character and high-fashion model.\" The drag star and beauty influencer was born in the US, raised in South Korea, and currently spends her time in Chicago with the perfect roommate, her \u003ca href=\"https://instagram.com/butterthisdog?utm_medium=copy_link\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efrench bulldog\u003c/a\u003e. After finishing in the top three on season eight of \u003cem\u003eRuPaul's Drag Race, \u003c/em\u003eKim Chi launched her cosmetic company, \u003ca href=\"https://kimchichicbeauty.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eKimChi Chic Beauty\u003c/a\u003e, with entrepreneur and NYX founder Toni Ko in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWe asked Kim Chi a few Icebreakers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat's the most important thing you learned when launching your beauty brand?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eTo have fun and to create products you know you're gonna have fun with! I think people really vibe with that!\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho would your dream celebrity collaboration be with?\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://instagram.com/loonatheworld?utm_medium=copy_link\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLOONA\u003c/a\u003e!!! Haha I love them so much!\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho creates some of your favorite content online?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eMy friend \u003ca href=\"https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMdrkR2KF/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eJonathan Kung\u003c/a\u003e creates thoughtful content about food and cooking; \u003ca href=\"https://instagram.com/timothyhungcom?utm_medium=copy_link\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTimothy Hung\u003c/a\u003e is an amazing makeup artist.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat skills could modern business people gain from becoming drag queens?\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eMerchandising, visual merchandising, negotiating for rates, and most importantly, learning how to weed out scammers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat topic do you wish was a college major but isn't?\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe history of zombies in pop culture.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is your favorite compliment you've ever received?\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\"You always show up on time!\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat question do you wish people would ask you? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\"Have you had your iced coffee today? Would you like some?\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis interview has been lightly edited and condensed for clarity.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F17%2Ficebreakers-withdrag-queen-kimchi\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;\"\u003e\n \n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"column\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nMake It Work: Vax Talk in the Office\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eEach week, Morning Brew's Head of People Ops Kate Noel answers \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereader-submitted questions\u003c/a\u003e about work in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFor personal reasons, I don't want to get vaccinated. How do I respond to colleagues asking if I've been vaccinated yet? It seems there's a lot of uncomfortable social pressure around this topic. Thanks, Chris.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI have noticed that the privacy coworkers used to exercise around personal health information has relaxed over the past year. My own stance on Covid vaccinations aside, I don’t think it’s a proper workplace conversation to have unless in a formal capacity from your employer. And even then it can get a little tricky, which is why we leave that kind of stuff to the professionals who are trained in workplace sensitivity (just in case you’re confused about who that is, boo, that’s me and my friends in human resources).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eNext time one of your coworkers asks you if you’re vaccinated, just say you’re not comfortable sharing personal health decisions or anything else about your medical background. I do have to add that I hope you’ve done your research and made an educated decision on your stance on vaccinations, which have proven to be safe and effective against Covid and are the reason the US is nearly out of this mess. Either way, be thoughtful and follow the proper CDC guidelines for people who are unvaccinated. Summer’s finally here, let’s have fun…responsibly. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23923023.14227/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B1c068d44?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAsk Kate here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F18%2Fmake-work-tell-coworkers-im-not-vaccinated\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nThe Election in Wall Street's Backyard\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/18/know-nycs-upcoming-mayoral-election?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"NEW YORK, NY- JUNE 10: Before the second televised debate for the New Yo...\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDg2L25ld195b3JrX2NpdHlfbWF5b3JhbF9jYW0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eAndrew Lichtenstein/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIf you've so far managed to escape the Twitter buzz around the NYC mayoral race, your blissful ride has come to an end. Ahead of the big Democratic primary this Tuesday, here's a primer on the race to succeed Bill de Blasio and lead the country's most populous city. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho is running?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe better question is who \u003cem\u003eisn't \u003c/em\u003erunning? With \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nyc-mayoral-race-candidates-11623280789?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e13 candidates\u003c/a\u003e on the ballot for the Democratic primary, it's the biggest field in the city's history. Some notable candidates include Brooklyn Borough President Eric Adams, former sanitation commissioner Kathryn Garcia, tech entrepreneur and former presidential candidate Andrew Yang, and former Citigroup exec Ray McGuire.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho is Wall Street backing?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe city's powerful financiers have mostly thrown their weight behind Yang, McGuire, and Adams. Adams has recently received a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/14/nyc-mayor-race-wall-street-gives-millions-to-eric-adams-andrew-yang.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.5 million boost \u003c/a\u003efrom NY Mets owner and hedge fund manager Steve Cohen. Other Adams boosters include hedge fund manager Dan Loeb, Citadel CEO Ken Griffin, and legendary investors Stanley Druckenmiller and Paul Tudor Jones.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBig business may prefer Adams, a former NYPD captain, for his focus on public safety. Last October, more than 150 business leaders \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/10/nyregion/de-blasio-economy-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esent a letter\u003c/a\u003e to Mayor Bill de Blasio saying that degrading quality of life could hinder the city's economic recovery. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow will the election work? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFor the first time, the primary will utilize a format called \"\u003ca href=\"https://ballotpedia.org/Ranked-choice_voting_(RCV)?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eranked-choice voting\u003c/a\u003e,\" which is as if the Joker came along and sprinkled even more chaos onto an already unpredictable race. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/nyregion/ranked-choice-voting-nyc.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRanked-choice voting\u003c/a\u003e means that instead of checking one name off on a ballot, NYC voters will be able to put down up to five, ranked by their preference. For another real-world example, the best picture winner at the Oscars is selected by a version of ranked-choice voting. This method means being enough people's No. 2 choice could be a recipe for victory. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho is going to win? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe latest polls show \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/albany/story/2021/06/14/adams-garcia-top-latest-poll-in-new-york-mayors-race-1386402?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAdams in the lead\u003c/a\u003e followed by Garcia, who would be the first woman ever elected mayor of NYC.
